award_title: CAREER: Classical Many-Body Systems Beyond Leading Order
subject: computational methods that don't die with the paper
body:
Hi Matthew,

I'm a computational materials scientist who built something called Ouro after hitting the same wall you've probably run intoâ€”computational methods that stay locked in papers instead of being reusable.

Ouro is basically a thin API layer that lets other researchers call your computational workflows directly. No recreating methods from scratch, no emailing for code that may or may not run.

Figured it might be relevant for particle simulation work. Happy to show you a quick demo if you're curious.

Hope you have a good holiday season.

Cheers,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
